CatDescriptText: Mr. Patrick All, Lincoln Place and Mr. George Williams, postal employee, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 3, 1962, pg. 10 with question: "In what way do you think the successful orbiting of Col. John Glenn will aid the United States in its relationship with other countries?"  Mr. All's answer reads: "It will help by giving us more prestige.  We might be able to get together with Russia in pooling our space efforts."  Mr. Williams' answer reads: "It proves to other countries that we have smart scientists who are capable of doing anything that anyone else can do."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Patrick All wearing dark overcoat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of George Williams wearing cap, eyeglasses, patterned shirt, and leather coat, standing in front of building, Downtown
